title: Cultivate Your Own Edamame: A Guide to Growing and Enjoying Soybeans!

subtasks: Determine the best time to plant soybeans
Choose between planting from seeds or transplants
Prepare a container with the appropriate soil mix
Plant seeds or transplants at the recommended depth and spacing
Water newly planted seeds or transplants thoroughly
Monitor for pests and diseases (e.g., caterpillars, spider mites, rust)
Apply neem oil as a preventative or curative measure against pests and diseases
Ensure plants receive adequate sunlight (at least 6-8 hours daily)
Fertilize the plants with organic liquid fertilizer and worm tea every 2 weeks
Harvest the soybean pods when they are mature
Pay attention to root depth when selecting containers
Understand the nitrogen-fixing capabilities of soybean plants
Clean the soybean pods by removing excess debris
Coat the soybean pods with salt and oil (optional)
Cook the soybean pods in an air fryer
